noun.description: A congenital anomaly in which there is abnormal extension of one or both angles of the mouth, caused by abnormal fusion of the maxillary and mandibular processes of the embryo.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Handfield Jones (1819–1890), physician and histologist. From macro- + ancient Greek στόμα mouth + -ia; compare xerostomia, French macrostomie.
